title: Ban on single-use plastics starts in Mexico City
lead: The city’s government passed the ban on disposable plastic items in 2019 but it has just come into force

title: Government greenlights Ørsted’s Hornsea Three offshore wind farm
lead: The 2.4GW project is predicted to power the average daily needs of more than two million UK households

title: Mind the fridge: Brits ‘bin almost 42% of the food they buy every year’
lead: An estimated £2,675 of food is thrown away every year, according to new research

title: EU bank agrees €5.9bn support for renewables and green transport
lead: The European Investment Bank is backing the development of wind farms, the rollout of smart meters and improving the energy efficiency of public buildings

title: Good Energy to launch ‘time-of-use’ tariff for EV drivers
lead: It will offer a lower price and longer off-peak charging window, starting earlier in the evening compared to other tariffs on the market

title: Austrian bank and EIB to support sustainable projects with €300m funding
lead: Projects include onshore wind, solar and hydropower projects, in addition to electric vehicles and charging stations as well as the energy efficiency of companies and buildings

title: UK holds the ‘highest decarbonisation rate’ in the world for the 21st century so far
lead: The nation decreased carbon dioxide emissions by 3.7% every year, according to a new report

title: India lays foundation of the ‘country’s largest’ renewable energy park
lead: The 30GW park spreads across 70,000 hectares of land, equivalent to the size of Singapore

title: US solar panel installations predicted to have risen 43% throughout 2020
lead: A record 19GW of new solar capacity has been installed this year, according to a new report

title: Drones to locate abandoned oil and gas wells in New York
lead: The wells release methane, which is many times more potent than carbon dioxide as a greenhouse gas and is second only to CO2 in its overall contribution to climate change
